nodes.name: project
nodes.description: Any specifically defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement. (NCIt C47885)

properties.name: code
properties.description: Project code

properties.name: attribution
properties.description: Link to attribution prose provided by dbGaP

properties.name: name
properties.description: Display name or title for the project

properties.name: data_access_authority
properties.description: Name of organization which governs data access

properties.name: release_status
properties.description: Release status of the study.

properties.name: intended_release_date
properties.description: Tracks a Project's intended release date.

properties.name: releasable
properties.description: A project can only be released by the user when `releasable` is true.

properties.name: released
properties.description: To release a project is to include all submitted entities in the next release.

properties.name: version
properties.description: dbGaP version

properties.name: availability_type
properties.description: Is the project open or restricted?

properties.name: dbgap_accession_number
properties.description: The dbgap accession number for the project.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'project' table.

nodes.description: Collection of participants that represents a family

properties.name: external_id
properties.description: Name given to the family by contributor

properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'family' table.

nodes.name: participant
nodes.description: The collection of all data related to a specific subject in the context of a specific project.

properties.name: consent_type
properties.description: Type of the consent participant belongs to

properties.name: disease_type
properties.description: Full name for the project.

properties.name: lost_to_followup
properties.description: A yes o indicator related to whether a patient was unable to be contacted for follow-up.

properties.name: index_date
properties.description: The reference or anchor date used during date obfuscation, where a single date is obscurred by creating one or more date ranges in relation to this date.

properties.name: days_to_lost_to_followup
properties.description: The number of days between the date used for index and to the date the patient was lost to follow-up.

properties.name: family_id
properties.description: Id for the participants grouped by family

properties.name: primary_site
properties.description: Primary site for the project.

properties.name: is_proband
properties.description: Denotes whether participant is proband of study

properties.name: external_id
properties.description: Name given to participant by contributor

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'project' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'participant' table.

properties.name: family.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'family' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'participant' table.

properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'participant' table.

nodes.name: phenotype
nodes.description: Phenotype entity to describe the phenotype name given by contributor.

properties.name: observed
properties.description: Whether phenotype is negative or positive

properties.name: phenotype
properties.description: Name given to Phenotype by contributor

properties.name: hpo_id
properties.description: The ID of the term from Human Phenotype Ontology which represents a harmonized phenotype

properties.name: age_at_event_days
properties.description: Age at the time of diagnosis expressed.

properties.name: snomed_id_phenotype
properties.description: The ID of the term from Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine - Clinical Terms which encodes clinical terminology

properties.name: participant.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'participant' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'phenotype' table.

properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'phenotype' table.

nodes.name: demographic
nodes.description: Data for the characterization of the patient by means of segementing the population (e.g., characterization by age, sex, or race).

properties.name: cause_of_death
properties.description: Text term to identify the cause of death for a patient.

properties.name: gender
properties.description: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Explanatory Comment 1: Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]

properties.name: race
properties.description: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species. It usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and is characterized by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in the case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

properties.name: ethnicity
properties.description: An individual's self-described social and cultural grouping, specifically whether an individual describes themselves as Hispanic or Latino. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

properties.name: vital_status
properties.description: The survival state of the person registered on the protocol.

properties.name: age_at_last_follow_up_days
properties.description: The age in days at the last follow-up or death of the patient.

properties.name: participant.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'participant' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'demographic' table.

properties.name: demographic.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'demographic' table.

nodes.name: diagnosis
nodes.description: Data from the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

properties.description: The ID of the term from the Monary Disease Ontology which represents a harmonized diagnosis

nodes.name: sample
nodes.description: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

properties.name: time_between_clamping_and_freezing
properties.description: Numeric representation of the elapsed time between the surgical clamping of blood supply and freezing of the sample, measured in minutes.

properties.name: biospecimen_anatomic_site
properties.description: Text term that represents the name of the primary disease site of the submitted tumor sample.

properties.name: shortest_dimension
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the shortest dimension of the sample, measured in millimeters.

properties.name: method_of_sample_procurement
properties.description: The method used to procure the sample used to extract analyte(s).

properties.name: tissue_type
properties.description: Text term that represents a description of the kind of tissue collected with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue.

properties.name: intermediate_dimension
properties.description: Intermediate dimension of the sample, in millimeters.

properties.name: initial_weight
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the initial weight of the sample, measured in milligrams.

properties.name: days_to_sample_procurement
properties.description: The number of days from the date the patient was diagnosed to the date of the procedure that produced the sample.

properties.name: spatial_descriptor
properties.description: Ontology term that harmonizes the spatial concepts from Biological Spatial Ontology

properties.name: ncit_id_anatomical_site
properties.description: The ID term from the National Cancer Institute Thesaurus which represents a harmonized anatomical site

properties.name: external_id
properties.description: Name given to participant by contributor

properties.name: tumor_descriptor
properties.description: A description of the tumor from which the sample was derived.

properties.name: ncit_id_tissue_type
properties.description: The ID term from the National Cancer Institute Thesaurus which represents a harmonized tissue type

properties.name: preservation_method
properties.description: Text term that represents the method used to preserve the sample.

properties.name: age_at_event_days
properties.description: Age at the time of diagnosis expressed.

properties.name: days_to_collection
properties.description: Time interval from the date of biospecimen collection to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

properties.name: time_between_excision_and_freezing
properties.description: Numeric representation of the elapsed time between the excision and freezing of the sample, measured in minutes.

properties.name: diagnosis_pathologically_confirmed
properties.description: The histologic description of tissue or cells confirmed by a pathology review of frozen or formalin fixed slide(s) completed after the diagnostic pathology review of the tumor sample used to extract analyte(s).

properties.name: current_weight
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the current weight of the sample, measured  in milligrams.

properties.name: composition
properties.description: Text term that represents the cellular composition of the sample.

properties.name: longest_dimension
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the longest dimension of the sample, measured in millimeters.

properties.name: participant.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'participant' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'sample' table.

properties.name: diagnosis.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'diagnosis' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'sample' table.

properties.name: sample.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'sample' table.

nodes.name: aliquot
nodes.description: Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.

properties.name: analyte_type
properties.description: Text term that represents the kind of molecular specimen analyte.

properties.name: normal_tumor_genotype_snp_match
properties.description: Text term that represents whether or not the genotype of the normal tumor matches or if the data is not available.

properties.name: shipment_origin
properties.description: The origin of the shipment.

properties.name: concentration
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the concentration of an analyte or aliquot extracted from the sample or sample portion, measured in milligrams per milliliter.

properties.name: volume
properties.description: The volume in microliters (ml) of the aliquots derived from the analyte(s) shipped for  sequencing and characterization

properties.name: aliquot_quantity
properties.description: The quantity in micrograms (ug) of the aliquot(s) derived from the analyte(s) shipped for sequencing and characterization.

properties.name: ribosomal_rna_28s_16s_ratio
properties.description: The 28S/18S ribosomal RNA band ratio used to assess the quality of total RNA.

properties.name: external_id
properties.description: Name given to participant by contributor

properties.name: well_number
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the the well location within a plate for the analyte or aliquot from the sample.

properties.name: analyte_quantity
properties.description: The quantity in micrograms (ug) of the analyte(s) derived from the analyte(s) shipped for sequencing and characterization.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Weight in grams or volume in mL.

properties.name: shipment_destination
properties.description: The destination of the shipment.

properties.name: shipment_date
properties.description: The date item was shipped in YYYY-MM-DD format.

properties.name: a260_a280_ratio
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the sample ratio of nucleic acid absorbance at 260 nm and 280 nm, used to determine a measure of DNA purity.

properties.name: spectrophotometer_method
properties.description: Name of the method used to determine the concentration of purified nucleic acid within a solution.

properties.name: source_center
properties.description: Name of the center that provided the item.

properties.name: sample.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'sample' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'aliquot' table.

properties.name: aliquot.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'aliquot' table.

nodes.name: slide
nodes.description: A digital image, microscopic or otherwise, of any sample, or sub-part thereof.

properties.name: percent_tumor_nuclei
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of tumor nuclei in a malignant neoplasm sample or specimen.

properties.name: percent_monocyte_infiltration
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of monocyte infiltration in a sample or specimen.

properties.name: percent_normal_cells
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of normal cell content in a malignant tumor sample or specimen.

properties.name: percent_eosinophil_infiltration
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of infiltration by eosinophils in a tumor sample or specimen.

properties.name: percent_lymphocyte_infiltration
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of infiltration by lymphocytes in a solid tissue normal sample or specimen.

properties.name: percent_stromal_cells
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of reactive cells that are present in a malignant tumor sample or specimen but are not malignant such as fibroblasts, vascular structures, etc.

properties.name: section_location
properties.description: Tissue source of the slide.

properties.name: percent_necrosis
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of cell death in a malignant tumor sample or specimen.

properties.name: percent_granulocyte_infiltration
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of infiltration by granulocytes in a tumor sample or specimen.

properties.name: number_proliferating_cells
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the count of proliferating cells determined during pathologic review of the sample slide(s).

properties.name: percent_neutrophil_infiltration
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of infiltration by neutrophils in a tumor sample or specimen.

properties.name: percent_inflam_infiltration
properties.description: Numeric value to represent local response to cellular injury, marked by capillary dilatation, edema and leukocyte infiltration; clinically, inflammation is manifest by reddness, heat, pain, swelling and loss of function, with the need to heal damaged tissue.

properties.name: percent_tumor_cells
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the percentage of infiltration by granulocytes in a sample.

properties.name: sample.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'sample' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'slide' table.

properties.name: slide.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'slide' table.
